newsitem.title: TURKEY: Islamists charged with insulting Turk commander.
newsitem.headline: Islamists charged with insulting Turk commander.

text.p: A state prosecutor brought charges against two Islamist journalists on Tuesday for an article that allegedly insulted a leading commander of the Turkish armed forces, the semi-official Anotalian news agency said.

The agency said the office of the state prosecutor responsible for the media demanded up to 16 months imprisonment each for a columnist and an editor at the Islamist daily Akit, under two separate articles of the Penal Code.
"This is the first I've heard of this", Ali Karahasanoglu, responsible editor of the daily, told Reuters. "I only know that there has been an inquiry into it and I gave my testimony,"
The prosecutor's office refused to comment on the case.
Anatolian said the office charged the reporters for insulting Teoman Koman, head of Turkey's paramilitary gendarme forces, in the article headlined "Worship, morale and the army".
The editor said that the commander's name was not mentioned in the article nor were any direct or indirect imputations made about him in it.
"We only criticised a note from the Turkish army which reorganised mosques for soldiers. But at that time no one knew who ordered it, so there was no name in the article," he added.
